column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$4$Clonazepam was given to me for severe stress reasons due to a lower heart vavle conditions. Heart conditions usually start at the top of the heart
column4: my heart valve conditions started a the bottom of my heart where the stomach and esophagus meet extremely to that lower heart valve. There are indeed very lose to each other
column6: and swallowing became very difficult. I burped continually with some chest & back shoulder pain.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I take Seroquel for psychosis
column3: which works at keeeping  me on an ""even keel""
column4: but makes me tired and sleepy. The Clonazepam
column5: of which I take only a small dose TID
column6: not only helps with the panic attacks/anxiety I have
column7: but also has this pleasant side effect of making me very active
column8: quite the opposite of my ""normal"" self who is full of depression and can barely rise out of bed. It also seems to help with the chronic joint pain I have. I  also take Celexa
column9: which I can't tell if it works really
column11: no major ""episodes"" in the last 3 + years I've been on these 3 drugs for my bipolarism. Nope
column13: it made me very sick!  And I've tried many other anti-depressants and they have had very upsetting side effects. So
column14: there you have it! I'm just FULLA psych-meds! They work
column15: but take away a lot of the colors in life
column16: those ups and downs that we really value. I feel a lot like a zombie in limbo now
column17: honestly. But it is worth it
column18: if it keeps my 3 kids seeing that their mommy is in control of her mind now! It took a long time to gain their trust back
column20: thanks to the meds and the diagnosis finally! Thanks for reading my experience."
